page.title: 01PRENTON AND ENVIRONS
page.content: This area of{Wirral}is predominently arable, beef and dairy farmland, with most residential and commercial development to the north and east. It is bisected by the Bidston to Wrexham railway line and by the M53 motorway, with an intersection at{Woodchurch. Along the eastern edge lies{Storeton {Hill,}a sandstone ridge whose quarries, now filled in, provided stone for many local buildings. There are several local shopping centres in{Prenton}and{Bebington,}and also branches of supermarket chains. Education is provided at 7 primary schools. At 11+ children transfer to comprehensive schools, or to grammar and secondary modern schools. Club facilities exist for tennis, golf and rugby, with league football at{Tranmere Rovers.}The countryside is easily accessible by footpath or road.
